name: Augustine of Hippo
what_did:
Augustine wrote books about God, the soul, and human life.
He told the story of his own life in 'Confessions', one of the first true autobiographies.
He helped explain Christian beliefs during hard times for the Roman world.
why_matters:
Augustine shaped Christian thinking for over 1,000 years.
He taught about love, truth, and the struggles inside the human heart.
His books are still read by people learning about religion and philosophy.

questions.q: What religion was Augustine a part of?

fun_fact: Augustine once prayed: 'Give me self-control... but not yet!'
